result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kwamen D-Andre Russ

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kwamen D-Andre Russ in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant qualifies for SPD representation. Case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kwamen D-Andre Russ in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case in court for status of counsel. Defendant may qualify for SPD representation. Court ordered defendant to report directly to SPD office to be re-evaluated and return to court. Case passed.

Defendant Kwamen D-Andre Russ appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant informed the Court he has retained private counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kwamen D-Andre Russ in court.  Sarah Dahdouh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informed the court he is actively pursuing retaining counsel.Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Oral No Contact Order with  Qdoba 12345 W Capitol Dr or their parking lot.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kwamen D-Andre Russ in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/18/2022@130p
